text: Madeleine Mary Zeien Bordallo (; born May 31, 1933) is a Guamanian politician, who served as the Delegate from the United States territory of Guam to the United States House of Representatives from 2003 until 2019. She is the first woman ever to serve as Guam's Delegate. She is the first female Lieutenant Governor of Guam (from 1995 to 2003). As the wife of Ricardo Bordallo, she was also the First Lady of Guam from 1975 to 1979 and from 1983 to 1987. ==References== Category:1933 births Category:Living people Category:Lieutenant Governors of Guam Category:United States representatives Category:Politicians from Minnesota Category:Democratic Party (United States) politicians
